title: Craig Revel Horwood hits out at James Jordan over Strictly Come Dancing claims
text:
And he did not hold back! (Picture: ITV/Rex)

Craig Revel Horwood has hit out at James Jordan after he slammed the Strictly Come Dancing judges’ decision to axe Dev Griffin from the show last weekend.

The 54-year-old panellist has claimed that the dancing pro is ‘just out for the publicity’ after he and his three fellow judges – Motsi Mabuse, Shirley Ballas, and Bruno Tonioli, all opted to send the Radio 1 DJ home following his and Dianne Buswell’s dance-off against Viscountess Emma Weymouth and Aljaz Skorjanec.

James later shot to the defence of Dev and Dianne and claimed the judging was ‘all over the place’ and he even branded them ‘liars’.

Although Craig has now hit back at James and said that Dev was the worst dancer on the night and they did make the right decision.

He said: ‘James Jordan is just out for publicity and if he was on the judging panel, I’m telling you looking at it you have to judge on what you see.

‘Was Dev the right person to go on the night? Yes. Would he have been better in the future? Yes. Was he better in the past? Yes.

‘He just got a dance he wasn’t particularly good at and he made a mistake.

Dev and Dianne were eliminated (Picture: BBC)

‘Dev was the worst dancer on the night but if he had done his other routines then he may have been successful going through.’

Craig also took a swipe at fans of the show who were up in arms about Dev’s axing, insisting they know ‘nothing’ about dancing the cha cha cha.

Speaking at the Best Heroes Awards, he told the Daily Mirror: ‘They can kick off as much as they like.

‘How much do they know about the cha cha cha? Nothing darling … so they can kick off.’

The Strictly Come Dancing Judges decided to send Dev home

After Dev and Dianne were eliminated from the show, James admitted he felt ‘irritate by the judges’ and claimed to axe the pair was ‘a bit of a farce’.

He said: ‘I loved all of the dancing this week, but I was just irritated by the judges. It was such a great show, but we were disappointed that Dev and Dianne are gone! It happens every year, to be fair. Dev had so much to give. He was brilliant in my opinion.

‘I felt the show itself did its job, the pros did their job, the celebrities did their job, but the judges didn’t do their job. It was a bit of a farce.

James Jordan has branded the Strictly judges ‘liars’ Picture: Matt Frost/ITV/REX)

‘The wrong person this evening is gone. It comes from the judging being all over the place. I mean, David and Nadiya with 28 points in front of five other couples. It’s impossible.’

Advertisement

The star also took to Twitter to share his shock at the decision.

He tweeted: ‘How dare the judges say they are truly shocked!!! Liars!!! And it’s your fault! Fact!

‘Why can people not be more honest in the world…

‘The public have been watching long enough to call bull****!

‘Just mark what you see and then let the public decide…just do your job!’

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One and BBC iPlayer.
